courses.title: Computer Vision
courses.description: Image processing, object detection, and computer vision techniques

learningPaths.title: An Introduction to Vision
learningPaths.description: This chapter explores the fascinating world of human perception to understand its flaws and strengths. Through interactive illusions, we'll define the core challenge of computer vision: teaching a machine to see like us.

modules.title: From Light to Meaning – The Perception Pipeline
modules.description: Follow photons from the real world to perception while contrasting how humans and machines sense, limit, and interpret signals.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From Light to Meaning – The Perception Pipeline
Lesson 1.1: Example – The Machine's Eye (Real Life)
Lesson 1.2: Coding – Simulating Sensory Limits
Lesson 1.3: Exercise – Architect of the Senses
Lesson 1.4: Podcast – The User Interface of Reality

modules.title: The Constructive Brain – How Perception Deceives Us
modules.description: See how the brain fabricates reality through illusions, inverse problems, and pixel-versus-brain comparisons.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Constructive Brain – How Perception Deceives Us
Lesson 2.1: Experiment – The Illusionist's Workbench
Lesson 2.2: Coding – The Truth Detector: Pixels vs. Brain
Lesson 2.3: Manim Video – The Inverse Problem
Lesson 2.4: Example – Forced Perspective in Cinema
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – The Brain's Photoshop

modules.title: Attention, Pixels, and the Machine Gap
modules.description: Bridge human attention with pixel-level representations through visualizations, semantic-gap experiments, and hands-on coding.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Attention, Pixels, and the Machine Gap
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Image as a Function
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Semantic Gap Challenge
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Hacking the Pixel Matrix
Lesson 3.4: Podcast – The Dumb Camera

learningPaths.title: Perception Systems: From Human Vision to Digital Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter bridges the gap between biology and technology. We'll start by dissecting the human eye and brain to understand nature's masterpiece of vision. Then, we'll build a digital camera from the ground up, exploring the physics, hardware, and software that turn light into the digital images that power computer vision.

modules.title: The Physics of Light - The Raw Material of Vision
modules.description: Trace how electromagnetic waves become the raw material for vision, from wavelength and energy basics to hands-on explorations of invisible spectra.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Physics of Light - The Raw Material of Vision
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Wavelength-Energy Dance
Lesson 1.2: Coding - Simulating Light Reflection
Lesson 1.3: Exercise - Photons and Pixels
Lesson 1.4: Example - Seeing the Invisible (NDVI)
Lesson 1.5: Experiment - The Virtual Spectrometer
Lesson 1.6: Podcast - The Color of Reality

modules.title: Biological Hardware - The Eye and Retinal Processing
modules.description: Meet the eye as a sensor, explore retinal processing, and contrast biology with silicon through perception puzzles and Bayer decoding.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Biological Hardware - The Eye and Retinal Processing
Lesson 2.1: Podcast - Biological Engineering vs. Silicon
Lesson 2.2: Real-Life Example - Why the Internet Fought Over a Dress
Lesson 2.3: Manim Video - The Geometry of the Pinhole
Lesson 2.4: Exercise - Pinhole Projection Drills
Lesson 2.5: Coding - Hacking the Bayer Filter

modules.title: The Perception Pathway - Seeing with the Brain
modules.description: Follow signals into the cortex, map the visual field, and explore the dual streams of perception with experiments, coding, and real case studies.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Perception Pathway - Seeing with the Brain
Lesson 3.1: Manim Concept Explainer - Mapping the Visual Field
Lesson 3.2: Experiment - The Two Streams Showdown
Lesson 3.3: Exercise - The Neurologist Clinic
Lesson 3.4: Real-Life Example - The Case of Patient DF
Lesson 3.5: Coding - Mimicking the Cortex
Lesson 3.6: Podcast - Reality is a Controlled Hallucination

modules.title: The Math of Artificial Sight - Pinhole Cameras and Lenses
modules.description: Derive projection geometry, practice pinhole math, and build camera intuition through labs, calculators, and real-world examples.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Math of Artificial Sight - Pinhole Cameras and Lenses
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the Projection
Lesson 4.2: Practice - The Projection Calculator
Lesson 4.3: Python Lab - Coding a Pinhole Camera
Lesson 4.4: Real-World Example - Hacking Perception
Lesson 4.5: Podcast - The Upside Down World

modules.title: Digital Sensors, CMOS/CCD, and the Rolling Shutter
modules.description: Dig into modern image sensors, Bayer decoding, rolling shutter geometry, and the artifacts that appear when speed meets pixels.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Digital Sensors, CMOS/CCD, and the Rolling Shutter
Lesson 5.1: Coding - Breaking the Bayer Code
Lesson 5.2: Manim Math - The Geometry of Rolling Shutter
Lesson 5.3: Exercise - Forensic Physics
Lesson 5.4: Podcast - The Silicon Eye

modules.title: Digital Representation - From Signals to Data
modules.description: Convert captured light into numbers with quantization, bit depth drills, pixel math practice, and matrix-focused coding labs.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Digital Representation - From Signals to Data
Lesson 6.1: Manim Video - Visualizing Quantization
Lesson 6.2: Experiment - The Bit Depth and Color Playground
Lesson 6.3: Exercise - Pixel Math
Lesson 6.4: Coding - Hacking the Matrix
Lesson 6.5: Example - When RAW Matters
Lesson 6.6: Podcast - The Illusion of Color

learningPaths.title: Image Representation
learningPaths.description: This chapter deconstructs the digital image, revealing how the continuous, vibrant real world is translated into a structured grid of numbers. We will explore how space and color are quantized, discover the universal language of color science, and learn the fundamental analysis tools that form the bedrock of all computer vision.

modules.title: From the Real World to a Digital Grid
modules.description: Map continuous scenes onto discrete pixels with tensor intuition, resolution drills, and a first look at image data in code.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From the Real World to a Digital Grid
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video - Visualizing the Tensor
Lesson 1.2: Experiment - The Resolution Lab
Lesson 1.3: Coding - Hello NumPy
Lesson 1.4: Exercise - Grid Geometry
Lesson 1.5: Example - The First Pixel
Lesson 1.6: Podcast - Pixels, Screens, and Lies

modules.title: Quantizing Light and Basic Color
modules.description: Quantize light into numbers, explore the math with Manim, and get hands-on with coding, exercises, and podcast reflections.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Quantizing Light and Basic Color
Lesson 2.1: Manim Math Explainer
Lesson 2.2: Coding Lab
Lesson 2.3: Exercise Session
Lesson 2.4: Podcast - Quantization in Practice

modules.title: Mapping the Rainbow: Advanced Color Theory
modules.description: Dive into perceptual color spaces with visual explainers, coding challenges, real-world examples, and practice drills.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Mapping the Rainbow (Advanced Color Theory)
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer
Lesson 3.2: Coding Challenge
Lesson 3.3: Real-Life Example
Lesson 3.4: Exercise - Color Theory Drills
Lesson 3.5: Podcast Review

modules.title: Brightness, Contrast, and HDR
modules.description: Analyze brightness and contrast with experiments, histogram coding, bit-depth math, and real-world HDR applications.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Brightness, Contrast, and HDR
Lesson 4.1: Podcast - Don't Trust Your Eyes
Lesson 4.2: Experiment - The Histogram Playground
Lesson 4.3: Coding - Hacking Histograms in Python
Lesson 4.4: Manim Video - The Math of Bit Depth
Lesson 4.5: Example - Tunnel Vision in Autonomous Driving
Lesson 4.6: Exercise - Bit Depth and Storage

learningPaths.title: Image Formation: Transformations and Projections
learningPaths.description: This chapter builds a virtual camera from the ground up. We'll explore the mathematical language of 2D and 3D transformations, combine them to model a real camera, and see how this model powers everything from video games to robotic vision.

modules.title: The Hidden Dimension – Homogeneous Coordinates
modules.description: Discover the elegant mathematical "hack" that unifies all geometric operations. We'll introduce homogeneous coordinates, the secret language that allows us to describe complex transformations with simple matrix math.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Hidden Dimension – Homogeneous Coordinates
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing Ray Space
Lesson 1.2: Coding Lab – NumPy vs. Infinity
Lesson 1.3: Paper and Pencil – The Coordinate Gym
Lesson 1.4: Real World Context – The Renaissance Perspective
Lesson 1.5: Podcast – Why W? A Chat About the Hidden Dimension

modules.title: Moving Pictures – Basic 2D Transformations
modules.description: Learn to describe how objects move in the world without changing their shape. We'll build the matrices for translation, rotation, and uniform scaling, and experiment with them in an interactive playground.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Moving Pictures – Basic 2D Transformations
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Rotation Matrix
Lesson 2.2: Exercise – The Matrix Math Workout
Lesson 2.3: Experiment – The Parking Problem
Lesson 2.4: Real-World Example – How Your Phone Fixes Shaky Hands
Lesson 2.5: Coding – Implementing Affine Transformations in NumPy
Lesson 2.6: Podcast – The Magic of Matrices

modules.title: Warping Reality – Affine and Projective Transformations
modules.description: Move beyond rigid shapes and learn the transformations that bend and warp reality to create perspective. We'll explore the power of Affine and Projective transforms and see them at work in real-world applications like photo stitching and augmented reality.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Warping Reality – Affine and Projective Transformations
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the W Coordinate
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Virtual Document Scanner
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Bird's-Eye View for Self-Driving Cars
Lesson 3.4: Exercise – The Matrix Math Workout
Lesson 3.5: Example – Special Effects and Match Moving
Lesson 3.6: Podcast – The Perspective Shift

modules.title: Inside the Box – The Pinhole Camera and Intrinsics
modules.description: Dissect a virtual camera's internals. We'll define the camera's factory settings (intrinsics) and connect them to how light is projected through the pinhole model.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Inside the Box – The Pinhole Camera and Intrinsics
Lesson 4.1: Experiment – The Vertigo Effect
Lesson 4.2: Math Explainer – Deriving Matrix K
Lesson 4.3: Exercise – Pen and Paper Projection
Lesson 4.4: Coding – Building the Camera Class
Lesson 4.5: Real-World Example – Forced Perspective
Lesson 4.6: Podcast – The Cyclops Problem

modules.title: The World Stage – Extrinsics and the Full Matrix P
modules.description: Assemble the complete projection pipeline. We define camera extrinsics, chain them with intrinsics into matrix P, and code the full world-to-image transformation.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The World Stage – Extrinsics and the Full Matrix P
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Coordinate Chain
Lesson 5.2: The Extrinsics Simulator
Lesson 5.3: Pen and Paper Projection
Lesson 5.4: Building the Camera Projector in Python
Lesson 5.5: Podcast – The Camera in the Wild

modules.title: Applications – Synthetic Views and Stereo Vision
modules.description: Put the full camera model to work. We explore forward and inverse projection through cinematic effects, document scanning, AR overlays, and stereo depth.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Applications – Synthetic Views and Stereo Vision
Lesson 6.1: Manim Explainer – The Matrix Pipeline
Lesson 6.2: Experiment – The Hitchcock Effect (Dolly Zoom)
Lesson 6.3: Coding – The Document Scanner
Lesson 6.4: Exercise – Projection Math Gym
Lesson 6.5: Real-Life Example – Augmented Reality and Sports Lines
Lesson 6.6: Podcast – The Geometry of Sight

learningPaths.title: General Fourier Transform
learningPaths.description: This chapter demystifies one of the most powerful tools in engineering and computer science: the Fourier Transform. We will start with the beautiful intuition that complex signals are just recipes of simple sine waves, build the necessary mathematical tools, and finally apply this knowledge to filter and understand digital images.

modules.title: The Big Picture – Time, Frequency, and Superposition
modules.description: Discover the fundamental principle behind all signal processing through time, frequency, and superposition, building intuition for how complex signals are composed.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Big Picture – Time, Frequency, and Superposition
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing the Circle of Fifths
Lesson 1.2: Experiment – The Sound of Mathematics
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Constructing Waves in Python
Lesson 1.4: Podcast – Breaking the Wave

modules.title: The Intuition – How to Probe a Signal
modules.description: Build intuition for probing signals via correlation, guided experiments, and coding drills that reveal how to detect frequency content.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Intuition – How to Probe a Signal
Lesson 2.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing Correlation
Lesson 2.2: Experiment – The Chord Deconstructor
Lesson 2.3: Coding – Building a Frequency Scanner in Python
Lesson 2.4: Exercise – Manual Correlation
Lesson 2.5: Example – The Guitar Tuner
Lesson 2.6: Podcast – The Handshake of Waves

modules.title: The Math Toolkit – Complex Numbers and Oscillations
modules.description: Develop the complex-number toolkit behind Fourier analysis, from Euler’s jewel to phasor intuition and hands-on wave generation.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Math Toolkit – Complex Numbers and Oscillations
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing Euler’s Jewel
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Phasor Sum Playground
Lesson 3.3: Exercise – Gym for Imaginary Numbers
Lesson 3.4: Coding – Generating Waves with NumPy
Lesson 3.5: Example – Noise Cancellation Headphones
Lesson 3.6: Podcast – The Imaginary Friend

modules.title: Defining the Fourier Transform and Series
modules.description: Formalize the transform with winding intuition, hands-on correlation coding, and pen-and-paper drills grounded by Euler’s insights.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Defining the Fourier Transform and Series
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Winding Machine
Lesson 4.2: Coding – The Correlation
Lesson 4.3: Pen and Paper Challenge
Lesson 4.4: Podcast – Why Euler Makes Things Easier

modules.title: Deep Dive Example – The Square Wave
modules.description: Dive into orthogonality and synthesis with a square wave, blending math explainers, coding challenges, and coefficient drills.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Deep Dive Example – The Square Wave
Lesson 5.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing Orthogonality
Lesson 5.2: Coding Challenge – The Python Synthesizer
Lesson 5.3: Exercise – Master of Coefficients
Lesson 5.4: Podcast – The Symphony of Sums

modules.title: From 1D Signals to 2D Images
modules.description: Bridge 1D signal thinking to 2D images with winding intuition, FFT image hacks, playgrounds, and JPEG artifact forensics.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: From 1D Signals to 2D Images
Lesson 6.1: Visualizing the Winding Machine
Lesson 6.2: Pen and Paper – The Sawtooth Wave
Lesson 6.3: Hacking Images with FFT
Lesson 6.4: The Frequency Synthesizer Playground
Lesson 6.5: The Artifacts of JPEG
Lesson 6.6: Podcast – Breaking the Wave

learningPaths.title: Fourier Transform and Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter takes the concept of signal analysis from one dimension to two. We will discover how to view an image as a collection of "spatial frequencies," learn the mathematics behind the Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT), and deconstruct the JPEG compression algorithm, one of the most important technologies on the internet.

modules.title: Seeing Images as Signals
modules.description: Treat images as 2D signals. Build intuition for spatial frequency with visual math, hands-on experiments, Python hacking, and a wrap-up discussion.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Seeing Images as Signals
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer
Lesson 1.2: Experiment – The Frequency Detective
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Hacking the Row (Python)
Lesson 1.4: Podcast – Space, Time, and JPEGs

modules.title: Decoding the Frequency Grid
modules.description: Decode spatial frequency layouts with guided experiments, manual drills, coding masks, and a patterns-focused podcast.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Decoding the Frequency Grid
Lesson 2.2: Experiment – The Frequency Chef
Lesson 2.3: Exercise – Manual Decoding
Lesson 2.4: Coding – Coding a Frequency Mask
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – The Periodic Table of Patterns

modules.title: The Art of Compression – JPEG Part I
modules.description: Build the JPEG intuition: color transforms, subsampling, pipeline construction, bandwidth math, real-world examples, and perceptual tricks.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Art of Compression – JPEG Part I
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer – The Geometry of Color (RGB to YCbCr)
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Chroma Subsampling Playground
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Building the Pipeline (RGB to YCbCr in Python)
Lesson 3.4: Exercise – The Bandwidth Accountant
Lesson 3.5: Example – Why Green Screens are Green
Lesson 3.6: Podcast – Hacking the Human Eye

modules.title: Quantization and Artifacts – JPEG Part II
modules.description: Go deeper into lossy steps: visualize quantization loss, practice the math, build quantizers, study forensic clues, and debate compression artifacts.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Quantization and Artifacts – JPEG Part II
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Math of Loss
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Building the Quantizer
Lesson 4.4: Example – When Artifacts Reveal the Truth (JPEG Forensics)
Lesson 4.5: Podcast – The Deep-Fried Discussion

modules.title: From Light to Bytes – Summary
modules.description: Capstone wrap-up: sum of cosines, block-building lab, quantization drills, full JPEG coding, digital forensics, and reflections on throwing data away.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: From Light to Bytes – Summary
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Sum of Cosines
Lesson 5.2: Experiment – The Build-a-Block Workshop
Lesson 5.3: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers (Quantization)
Lesson 5.4: Coding – Coding a JPEG Compressor
Lesson 5.5: Example – Digital Forensics
Lesson 5.6: Podcast – The Art of Throwing Things Away

learningPaths.title: Image Characteristics
learningPaths.description: This chapter transitions from creating images to analyzing them. We'll learn how to distill a complex image into a few simple numbers—its 'character'—and discover why this is the essential first step for preparing images for advanced AI models.

modules.title: The Average Picture – Mean Value & Test Images
modules.description: Introduce image character through mean statistics and standard test images, moving from visual intuition to calculations, Python analysis, playground experimentation, and reflection.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Average Picture – Mean Value & Test Images
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Mean
Lesson 1.2: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Python Pixel Analysis
Lesson 1.4: Experiment – The Mean Matcher Playground
Lesson 1.5: Podcast – The Mean Meaning

modules.title: Measuring Contrast – Variance & Standard Deviation
modules.description: Quantify contrast with variance and standard deviation: visualize the math, work problems by hand, implement the metrics in NumPy, and compare perspectives through discussion.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Measuring Contrast – Variance & Standard Deviation
Lesson 2.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing Variance
Lesson 2.2: Exercise – Paper & Pen: Crunching the Contrast
Lesson 2.3: Coding – The Metrics (NumPy from Scratch)
Lesson 2.4: Podcast – The Tale of Two Images

modules.title: The Shape of the Image – Histograms
modules.description: Capture an image’s fingerprint with histograms. Translate pixels to bars, investigate thresholds, compute distributions, code visualizations, and relate histograms to real photos and stories.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Shape of the Image – Histograms
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video – From Pixels to Bars
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Thresholding Detective
Lesson 3.3: Exercise – Pen and Paper: Computing the Distribution
Lesson 3.4: Coding – Histograms in Python
Lesson 3.5: Real-Life Example – Photography and the Histogram
Lesson 3.6: Podcast – The Census of Pixels

modules.title: Chaos and Clean Data – Entropy & Normalization
modules.description: Measure randomness and tidy data. Visualize entropy, practice calculations, code image statistics, run the histogram doctor experiment, and debate why robots struggle with messy pixels.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Chaos and Clean Data – Entropy & Normalization
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video – Visualizing Entropy
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Image Statistics in Python
Lesson 4.4: Experiment – The Histogram Doctor
Lesson 4.5: Podcast – Why Robots Hate Pixels

learningPaths.title: Image Modifications
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from analyzing images to actively changing them. We'll build a toolkit of fundamental techniques to manipulate pixel values, learning how to enhance images for human eyes, prepare them for algorithms, and normalize them for powerful machine learning models.

modules.title: The Why and How of Modifying Pixels
modules.description: Launch into pixel transformations: why we modify images, the core math, and hands-on practice from visual intuition to coding and real-life examples.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Why and How of Modifying Pixels
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video – Visualizing Transformation Math
Lesson 1.2: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Building a LUT Engine
Lesson 1.4: Real-Life Example – Seeing the Invisible
Lesson 1.5: Podcast – The Pixel Perfect Podcast

modules.title: Mastering Brightness and Contrast – Linear Transformations
modules.description: Control images with linear math: visualize the equations, calculate pixels, code brightness and contrast adjustments, and apply them in medical imaging contexts.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Mastering Brightness and Contrast – Linear Transformations
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing the Math
Lesson 2.2: Exercise – Calculate the Pixels
Lesson 2.3: Coding – Brightness and Contrast
Lesson 2.4: Podcast – The Contrast Knob
Lesson 2.5: Experiment – The Medical Imaging Station

modules.title: The Human Eye and Gamma Correction
modules.description: Match human perception with non-linear gamma correction. Visualize the curve, explore a digital darkroom, run pixel math challenges, code gamma in Python, and discuss pitfalls.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Human Eye and Gamma Correction
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer – Bending the Light
Lesson 3.2: The Digital Darkroom
Lesson 3.3: Pixel Math Challenge
Lesson 3.4: Coding – Gamma in Python
Lesson 3.5: Podcast – The Gamma Deception

modules.title: Histogram Equalization (HE)
modules.description: Let data drive contrast boosts. Work through equalization theory, exercises, coding from scratch, and a discussion on hidden details and noise.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Histogram Equalization (HE)
Lesson 4.1: Exercise – The 3-Bit Challenge
Lesson 4.2: Coding – Building the Equalizer from Scratch
Lesson 4.3: Podcast – Hidden Details and Noise

learningPaths.title: Simple Filters (Kernels)
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond single-pixel analysis to explore the foundational technique of neighborhood operations: convolution. You'll learn how small matrices called kernels can be used to blur, sharpen, and find edges in an image, and discover how this classical technique forms the conceptual bedrock of modern AI vision systems.

modules.title: The Mathematics of Neighborhoods – The Convolution Operation
modules.description: Build the foundation for neighborhood operations. We explore sliding windows, human intuition, real-life analogies, hands-on coding, and a playground for the convolution operation.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Mathematics of Neighborhoods – The Convolution Operation
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video – Visualizing the Slide
Lesson 1.2: Pencil & Paper – The Human Convolver
Lesson 1.3: The Moving Average – A Real-Life Analogy
Lesson 1.4: Coding – Convolution from Scratch
Lesson 1.5: The Convolution Playground
Lesson 1.6: Podcast – The Neighborhood Watch

modules.title: Living on the Edge – Handling Image Borders
modules.description: Tackle padding and border effects while keeping filters stable. Visualize convolution mechanics, test kernels in the lab, crunch numbers by hand, build filters in Python, and recap why neighborhoods matter.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Living on the Edge – Handling Image Borders
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Mechanics of Convolution
Lesson 2.2: Experiment – The Kernel Laboratory
Lesson 2.3: Exercise – Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 2.4: Coding – Building Filters in Python
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – The Recap: Why Neighborhoods Matter

modules.title: The Art of Blur and Sharpen
modules.description: Master smoothing and sharpening filters. Visualize blur shapes, practice kernel arithmetic, build your own filters, and debate the trade-offs between softening noise and preserving detail.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Art of Blur and Sharpen
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Shape of Blur
Lesson 3.2: Exercise – Kernel Crunch
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Build Your Own Filters
Lesson 3.4: Podcast – Blurry Logic, Sharp Wits

modules.title: Hunting for Edges – Sobel and Gradients
modules.description: Turn gradients into edges. We unpack Sobel math, work through exercises, implement the operator, run edge experiments, and ground it all in real driving examples and discussion.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Hunting for Edges – Sobel and Gradients
Lesson 4.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing the Slope
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – The Sobel Arithmetic
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Implementing Sobel from Scratch
Lesson 4.4: Experiment – The Edge Detective
Lesson 4.5: Example – Keeping the Car on the Road
Lesson 4.6: Podcast – The Edge of Reason

modules.title: The Big Picture – From Handcrafted to Learned
modules.description: Connect classical filters to learned ones. Explore sliding window intuition, run kernel labs, practice paper processing, build a Photoshop-like pipeline, and see lane detection and broader AI parallels.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Big Picture – From Handcrafted to Learned
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video – The Sliding Window Symphony
Lesson 5.2: Experiment – The Kernel Laboratory
Lesson 5.3: Exercise – Paper Processing
Lesson 5.4: Coding – Building Photoshop in Python
Lesson 5.5: Example – Lane Detection in Self-Driving Cars
Lesson 5.6: Podcast – The Matrix Revolution

learningPaths.title: Advanced Kernels: Morphology and Gabor Filters
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond simple linear filters to explore two powerful, non-linear techniques. First, we'll learn how to manipulate object shapes with Morphological Filters to clean up noise and analyze geometry. Then, we'll dive into Gabor Filters to understand how we can describe and detect texture, building a crucial bridge between classical computer vision and the inner workings of modern AI.

modules.title: The Shape of Things – Basic Morphological Operations
modules.description: Discover how to sculpt digital images. We'll introduce the fundamental operations of Dilation and Erosion to grow and shrink objects, and then combine them into sophisticated tools for removing noise and perfecting shapes.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Shape of Things – Basic Morphological Operations
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing the Slide
Lesson 1.2: Exercise – Manual Morphology
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Implementing Basic Morphology
Lesson 1.4: Experiment – The OCR Repair Shop
Lesson 1.5: Podcast – The "Buff SpongeBob" Recap

modules.title: Cleaning Up the Mess – Compound Operations & Noise Removal
modules.description: Learn how to combine basic morphological tools for advanced image cleaning. We'll master Opening and Closing to precisely remove "salt" and "pepper" noise, and see how the Median Filter offers a robust alternative.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Cleaning Up the Mess – Compound Operations & Noise Removal
Lesson 2a: Manim Video - Visualizing the Math – Why Median Beats Mean
Lesson 2b: Experiment Lesson - The Morphological Laboratory
Lesson 2c: Exercise Lesson - Paper & Pencil Morphology
Lesson 2d: Coding Lesson - Digital Restoration
Lesson 2e: Podcast Lesson - The Janitors of Computer Vision

modules.title: Understanding Texture – The Gabor Filter
modules.description: Shift focus from shape to texture. We'll deconstruct the Gabor filter to understand how it mimics the human visual system by combining a wave and a window to detect patterns at specific orientations and scales. This capstone module reveals the profound connection between this classical technique and the automatically learned features in modern Convolutional Neural Networks.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Understanding Texture – The Gabor Filter
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer – Constructing the Gabor Filter
Lesson 3.2: Coding – Implementing a Texture Detector
Lesson 3.3: Experiment – The Morphological Cleanup Crew
Lesson 3.4: Exercise – Morphological Arithmetic
Lesson 3.5: Real Life Example – CSI: Fingerprint Analysis
Lesson 3.6: Podcast – From Shapes to Brain Waves

learningPaths.title: Convolutional Neural Networks
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from manual filters to the revolutionary architecture that allows machines to learn to see. We will deconstruct the Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), explore its mathematical engine, and discover how this powerful tool learns to recognize objects, building a bridge between raw pixels and intelligent perception.

modules.title: Why Traditional Networks Fail on Images
modules.description: Discover why traditional neural networks fail spectacularly when faced with images. We will explore the parameter explosion problem and see why fully connected layers are impractical for image data.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Why Traditional Networks Fail on Images
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing the Explosion
Lesson 1.2: Exercise – The Parameter Calculator
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Crashing the System (Safely)
Lesson 1.4: Podcast – "The 4K Image Disaster"

modules.title: The CNN Paradigm – Local Connectivity & Shared Weights
modules.description: Unveil the three elegant, biologically-inspired principles that form the foundation of every modern computer vision model: local connectivity, shared weights, and spatial hierarchies.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The CNN Paradigm – Local Connectivity & Shared Weights
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Lesson - Visualizing Connectivity
Lesson 2.2: Exercise Lesson - The Parameter Explosion
Lesson 2.3: Example Lesson - Biological Inspiration – The Cat Experiment
Lesson 2.4: Coding Lesson - Proving it in PyTorch
Lesson 2.5: Podcast Lesson - The "Efficient Detective"

modules.title: The Mathematics of Convolution
modules.description: Go under the hood to understand the computational engine of a CNN. Through animated explainers and hands-on experiments, we'll master the core operation of convolution that turns images into feature maps.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Mathematics of Convolution
Lesson 3a: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the Math: Convolution vs. Cross-Correlation
Lesson 3b: Experiment - The Kernel Laboratory
Lesson 3c: Exercises - Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 3d: Example - Before AI: The Sobel Operator
Lesson 3e: Coding - Building Convolution from Scratch
Lesson 3f: Podcast - The Great Convolution Debate

modules.title: Tuning the Engine – Stride and Padding
modules.description: Master the critical parameters that control how convolutions transform image dimensions. Learn how stride and padding give us precise control over feature map sizes and enable us to build deeper networks.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Tuning the Engine – Stride and Padding
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing the Formula
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – The Dimension Detective
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Building Layers in PyTorch
Lesson 4.4: Example – The Elegance of VGG16
Lesson 4.5: Podcast – "Living on the Edge"

modules.title: Pooling, Hierarchy, and Interpretation
modules.description: Discover how pooling operations create translation invariance and build hierarchical representations. Learn what CNNs truly learn by visualizing their internal filters and understanding the feature hierarchy that emerges.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Pooling, Hierarchy, and Interpretation
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing Translation Invariance
Lesson 5.2: Exercise – Be the Pooling Layer
Lesson 5.3: Coding – Implementing MaxPool from Scratch
Lesson 5.4: Experiment – The Feature Hierarchy Playground
Lesson 5.5: Real-World Example – The Wolf, The Husky, and The Snow
Lesson 5.6: Podcast – The Lazy Neural Network

learningPaths.title: Classification with Deep Learning: The AlexNet Revolution
learningPaths.description: This chapter marks a pivotal moment in AI history. We'll travel back to 2012 to dissect the AlexNet model, a deep neural network that shattered all previous records in image recognition and single-handedly launched the modern deep learning era. Through a mix of theory, hands-on experiments, and coding exercises, you will understand not just how this model worked, but why it changed the world.

modules.title: The Spark That Lit the Fire – History & Dataset
modules.description: We set the stage by exploring the state of computer vision before 2012, characterized by slow, incremental progress. We will then witness the "earthquake" moment when AlexNet arrived, quantifying its staggering leap in performance and understanding its immediate impact on the field.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Spark That Lit the Fire – History & Dataset
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing Top-k Error
Lesson 1.2: Exercise – Calculating the Score
Lesson 1.3: Coding – Implementing the Metrics
Lesson 1.4: Experiment – The Human Benchmark
Lesson 1.5: Podcast – The Day Vision Changed

modules.title: More Data from Thin Air – Data Augmentation
modules.description: A model is nothing without its fuel. Here, we dive into the massive ImageNet dataset that powered AlexNet. You will learn the crucial preprocessing steps and the clever data augmentation techniques used to prevent the model from simply memorizing data, a concept you will then apply yourself in a hands-on lab and your first PyTorch coding exercise.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: More Data from Thin Air – Data Augmentation
Lesson 2.1: Visualizing the Math – PCA Color Jitter
Lesson 2.2: The Overfitting Playground
Lesson 2.3: Calculating the Multiplier
Lesson 2.4: Coding - The AlexNet Pipeline
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – "The Art of Fake Data"

modules.title: Anatomy of a Winner – The Architecture
modules.description: Let's look under the hood. In this module, we dissect the 8-layer architecture of AlexNet, piece by piece. We will explore its key innovations, like the game-changing ReLU activation function, and understand the engineering feats required to make it work on the hardware of the time. You will then get to build these components in code.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Anatomy of a Winner – The Architecture
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer – The Vanishing Gradient
Lesson 3.2: Coding – Building the Beast in PyTorch
Lesson 3.3: Exercise – The Dimension Detective
Lesson 3.4: Experiment – Inside the Activation
Lesson 3.5: Podcast – The "Deep" Debate

modules.title: Training the Beast & The Aftermath
modules.description: With 60 million parameters, AlexNet was a powerful but wild beast, prone to overfitting. This module covers the art of training and regularization. You will learn about the crucial Dropout technique and then apply it yourself in an interactive playground and a coding exercise to see its dramatic effect on taming an overconfident model. We will also explore what AlexNet actually learned and why it remains so important today through Transfer Learning.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Training the Beast & The Aftermath
Lesson 4.1: Manim Math Explainer – Momentum in Motion
Lesson 4.2: Experiment – The Dropout Playground
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Transfer Learning in PyTorch
Lesson 4.4: Exercise – The Math of Training
Lesson 4.5: Example – From Cats to Cancer
Lesson 4.6: Podcast – The AlexNet Afterparty

learningPaths.title: The Evolution of CNN Architectures for Classification
learningPaths.description: This chapter traces the historical "race to go deeper" in neural network design. From the foundational models to the hyper-efficient architectures of today, we will uncover the recurring pattern of innovation where each breakthrough solves a problem created by the last, ultimately leading to the powerful models that define modern AI.

modules.title: Setting the Stage – Preprocessing & The "Race to Depth"
modules.description: Lay the groundwork for deep CNNs with scaling, normalization, and robustness drills before we start stacking layers.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Setting the Stage – Preprocessing & The "Race to Depth"
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Geometry of Normalization
Lesson 1.2: Coding Lab – Building a Preprocessing Pipeline
Lesson 1.3: Experiment – The Robustness Sandbox
Lesson 1.4: Podcast – The Unsung Heroes of Deep Learning

modules.title: The Power of Simplicity – LeNet & VGGNet
modules.description: See how early CNN blueprints balanced simplicity and depth, and code through classic VGG-style blocks.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Power of Simplicity – LeNet & VGGNet
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Math of "Seeing More with Less"
Lesson 2.2: Exercise – The Architectural Accountant
Lesson 2.3: Coding – Building a VGG Block in PyTorch
Lesson 2.4: Experiment – The Receptive Field Simulator
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – "The Day We Went Deep"

modules.title: Going Wide & Efficient – GoogLeNet & Inception
modules.description: Explore bottlenecks, width, and parameter efficiency with Inception-style designs and real-world applications.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Going Wide & Efficient – GoogLeNet & Inception
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer – Visualizing the Bottleneck
Lesson 3.2: Exercise – The Parameter Accountant
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Building Inception in PyTorch
Lesson 3.4: Example – Inception in the Wild (Medical Imaging)
Lesson 3.5: Podcast – "We Need To Go Deeper"

modules.title: Solving the Paradox of Depth – ResNet
modules.description: Follow the residual shortcut that fixed degradation and practice tensor arithmetic for deep stacks.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Solving the Paradox of Depth – ResNet
Lesson 4.1: Manim Math Explainer – The Gradient Superhighway
Lesson 4.2: Coding Lab – Building a Residual Block
Lesson 4.3: Exercise Gym – Tensor Shapes & Parameters
Lesson 4.4: Podcast – The "Deep" Revolution
Lesson 4.5: Experiment – The Degradation Visualizer

modules.title: The Modern Era – Width, Attention, & Scaling
modules.description: Close with modern scaling laws, attention-era tweaks, and transfer moments that defined today's CNN practice.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Modern Era – Width, Attention, & Scaling
Lesson 5.1: Experiment – The Augmentation Lab
Lesson 5.2: Manim Video – The Math of the Bottleneck
Lesson 5.3: Exercise – The Parameter Counting Gym
Lesson 5.4: Coding – Building a Residual Block
Lesson 5.5: Example – The ImageNet Moment & Transfer Learning
Lesson 5.6: Podcast – The Architecture Wars

learningPaths.title: Attention and its Application to Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter introduces the revolutionary attention mechanism, a concept that fundamentally changed deep learning. We'll explore why traditional models struggle with 'long-term memory' and then build the attention mechanism from the ground up, moving from an intuitive analogy to its powerful mathematical engine. Finally, we'll see how this new paradigm challenges the reign of convolutions in computer vision.

modules.title: The Limits of Local Vision
modules.description: Discover the hidden limitations of our most powerful vision and language models. We'll explore why CNNs have 'tunnel vision' and why RNNs are 'forgetful', setting the stage for a new kind of solution.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Limits of Local Vision
Lesson 1.1: Concept Lesson - The Limits of Local Vision
Lesson 1.2: Experiment Lesson - The Receptive Field Calculator
Lesson 1.3: Concept Lesson - A Detour into Language
Lesson 1.4: Coding Lesson - Breaking an RNN
Lesson 1.5: Concept Lesson - The Search Engine of the Mind
Lesson 1.6: Concept Lesson - Under the Hood - The Math of Attention
Lesson 1.7: Manim Video Lesson - Visualizing the Dot Product
Lesson 1.8: Exercise Lesson - Calculating Attention by Hand
Lesson 1.9: Coding Lesson - Implementing Self-Attention from Scratch
Lesson 1.10: Concept Lesson - The Problem of Order
Lesson 1.11: Experiment Lesson - The Wave Check
Lesson 1.12: Concept Lesson - Building the Transformer
Lesson 1.13: Concept Lesson - A New Paradigm (Attention vs. Convolution)
Lesson 1.14: Example Lesson - The ViT Revolution
Lesson 1.15: Podcast Lesson - The Day Convolutions Died?

modules.title: A Detour into Language (The RNN Bottleneck)
modules.description: Explore why RNNs struggle with long-term memory and how this limitation motivated the development of attention mechanisms.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: A Detour into Language (The RNN Bottleneck)
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video - Math Explainer - The Vanishing Vector
Lesson 2.2: Experiment - The Digital Telephone Game
Lesson 2.3: Coding - Coding the RNN Loop
Lesson 2.4: Podcast - The Amnesiac Robot

modules.title: The Search Engine of the Mind (Q, K, V)
modules.description: Learn the beautiful and intuitive analogy at the heart of the attention mechanism. Through a 'database retrieval' model, we'll demystify how a system can dynamically decide what information is most relevant.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Search Engine of the Mind (Q, K, V)
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video - Visual Explainer
Lesson 3.2: Exercise - The Context Detective
Lesson 3.3: Coding - Coding the Ingredients
Lesson 3.4: Podcast - The Library in the Matrix

modules.title: Under the Hood - The Math of Attention
modules.description: Go 'under the hood' to translate the Query, Key, and Value analogy into concrete mathematics. We'll build the attention formula step-by-step and implement it ourselves to solidify our understanding.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Under the Hood - The Math of Attention
Lesson 4.1: Manim Math Explainer - Visualizing the Matrix Dance
Lesson 4.2: Exercise - Pen & Paper - Calculating Context
Lesson 4.3: Coding - Code It - Self-Attention from Scratch
Lesson 4.4: Podcast - "The "Soft" in Softmax"

modules.title: The Problem of Order (Positional Encoding)
modules.description: Move from a single mechanism to a complete, stackable deep learning unit. We'll add crucial components like Positional Encoding and Multi-Head Attention to construct a full Transformer Block.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Problem of Order (Positional Encoding)
Lesson 5.1: Concept - The Limits of Local Vision
Lesson 5.2: Real-World Example - Context is King
Lesson 5.3: Concept - A Detour into Language
Lesson 5.4: Concept - The Search Engine of the Mind
Lesson 5.5: Manim Video - Visualizing Q, K, and V
Lesson 5.6: Concept - Under the Hood - The Math of Attention
Lesson 5.7: Manim Video - The Mechanics of the Matrix
Lesson 5.8: Exercise - Cranking the Numbers
Lesson 5.9: Coding - Coding Self-Attention
Lesson 5.10: Concept - The Problem of Order
Lesson 5.11: Manim Video - Waves of Order
Lesson 5.12: Coding - Generating the Waves
Lesson 5.13: Concept - Building the Transformer
Lesson 5.14: Experiment - Inside the Heads
Lesson 5.15: Concept - A New Paradigm
Lesson 5.16: Podcast - The Attention Revolution

modules.title: Building the Transformer (MHSA & Blocks)
modules.description: Move from a single mechanism to a complete, stackable deep learning unit. We'll add crucial components like Positional Encoding and Multi-Head Attention to construct a full Transformer Block.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Building the Transformer (MHSA & Blocks)
Lesson 6.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Dimensionality Dance
Lesson 6.2: Exercise - Transformer Architect
Lesson 6.3: Coding - Building the Multi-Head Monster
Lesson 6.4: Podcast - "Attention Is All You Need"

modules.title: A New Paradigm (Attention vs. Convolution)
modules.description: Witness the grand showdown between Attention and Convolution. We'll compare their fundamental philosophies and explore the critical trade-offs that define the modern landscape of computer vision.

lessons.title: Lesson 7: A New Paradigm (Attention vs. Convolution)
Lesson 7.1: Manim Video - The Dance of Matrices
Lesson 7.2: Exercise - Crunching the Attention Scores
Lesson 7.3: Coding - Building Self-Attention from Scratch
Lesson 7.4: Podcast - The Transformer Revolution

learningPaths.title: Vision Transformer
learningPaths.description: This chapter dives into the revolutionary Transformer architecture. We'll start with its origins in natural language processing and then explore how it was brilliantly adapted for computer vision, first with the groundbreaking Vision Transformer (ViT) and then refined with the efficient and powerful Swin Transformer.

modules.title: The Transformer Blueprint
modules.description: We begin by dissecting the model that changed NLP forever. You'll learn the roles of the Encoder and Decoder, and understand the core mechanism of Self-Attention that allows a model to weigh the importance of different words in a sentence.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Transformer Blueprint
Lesson 1.1: Manim Math Explainer - The Geometry of Attention
Lesson 1.2: Coding - Building Self-Attention from Scratch
Lesson 1.3: Experiment - The Positional Encoding Playground
Lesson 1.4: Exercise - Tracing the Tensor Shapes
Lesson 1.5: Podcast - "Attention Is All You Need" (The Discussion)

modules.title: From Text to Pixels - The Vision Transformer (ViT)
modules.description: Meet the first pure-Transformer architecture to achieve state-of-the-art results on image classification. We'll break down its clever strategy of turning images into sequences of patches and analyze its "data-hungry" nature.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: From Text to Pixels - The Vision Transformer (ViT)
Lesson 2.1: Exercise - The Mathematics of Attention vs. Convolution
Lesson 2.2: Coding - Building the Patch Embedding Layer
Lesson 2.3: Manim Video - Visualizing the Complexity Explosion
Lesson 2.4: Experiment - The "Attention" Playground
Lesson 2.5: Podcast - "Did We Just Turn Images into Language?"

modules.title: The Data Hunger Games - Inductive Bias
modules.description: Discover the fundamental barrier to applying Transformers to images. We'll do the math to understand the O(D⁴) computational explosion and explore the incredible prize that motivated researchers to solve it: the global receptive field. Compare CNNs and ViT to understand inductive bias.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Data Hunger Games - Inductive Bias
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer - Visualizing Bias
Lesson 3.2: The Training Ground - CNN vs. ViT
Lesson 3.3: Visualizing the Global Eye
Lesson 3.4: Receptive Field Arithmetic
Lesson 3.5: Podcast - The Bitter Lesson

modules.title: Evolution - The Swin Transformer
modules.description: Explore the evolution of ViT. The Swin Transformer re-introduces the wisdom of CNNs—locality and hierarchy—to create a model that is both more efficient and more versatile, thanks to its brilliant shifted-window attention mechanism.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Evolution - The Swin Transformer
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video - Visualizing the Quadratic Explosion
Lesson 4.2: Coding - Building the Patch Embedding Layer
Lesson 4.3: Exercise - Calculating Attention Output
Lesson 4.4: Experiment - The Inductive Bias Playground
Lesson 4.5: Example - DINO and the Emerging Object
Lesson 4.6: Coding - Swin Window Shifting
Lesson 4.7: Podcast - "Are Convolutions Dead?"

learningPaths.title: Object Detection Fundamentals
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from simple image classification to the more complex and practical task of object detection. We'll define the core problem, master the metrics used to evaluate performance, and trace the evolution of the pioneering R-CNN family of detectors, laying the groundwork for all modern object detection systems.

modules.title: The Object Detection Paradox & IoU
modules.description: Learn why finding objects is much harder than just naming an image. We'll define the dual challenges of localization and handling a variable number of outputs, establishing why object detection is a combined classification and regression task. Master the fundamental metric of Intersection over Union (IoU) and learn how to use it to decide if a prediction is a "hit" or a "miss".

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Object Detection Paradox & IoU
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video - Visualizing Intersection over Union
Lesson 1.2: Exercise - The IoU Gym
Lesson 1.3: Coding - Implementing the Jaccard Index
Lesson 1.4: Podcast - The Box Paradox

modules.title: The Scorecard - AP and mAP
modules.description: Go beyond single predictions to evaluate the entire model. We'll explore the trade-off between Precision and Recall, build the P-R curve, and master the industry-standard metrics of Average Precision (AP) and mean Average Precision (mAP).

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Scorecard - AP and mAP
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video - Visualizing the Area Under the Curve
Lesson 2.2: Experiment - The Confidence Slider
Lesson 2.3: Exercise - Calculating the Score
Lesson 2.4: Coding - Implementing Average Precision
Lesson 2.5: Podcast - The Metric Trap

modules.title: The Region-Based Revolution (R-CNN)
modules.description: Travel back to 2014 to meet R-CNN, the complex but revolutionary model that started it all. We will dissect its multi-stage "propose-then-classify" pipeline and understand its critical performance bottlenecks.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Region-Based Revolution (R-CNN)
Lesson 3.1: Manim Math Explainer - The Geometry of IoU
Lesson 3.2: Coding - Implementing IoU from Scratch
Lesson 3.3: Experiment - The Selective Search Playground
Lesson 3.4: Exercise - The Cost of Computation
Lesson 3.5: Podcast - "The Object Detection Big Bang"

modules.title: Speeding Up - NMS and Fast R-CNN
modules.description: Witness how two elegant innovations—shared computation and multi-task learning—transformed the clunky R-CNN into the dramatically faster and more elegant Fast R-CNN, setting the stage for all modern detectors.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Speeding Up - NMS and Fast R-CNN
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video - Math Explainer - Visualizing mAP
Lesson 4.2: Exercise - Pen & Paper - The Object Detection Gym
Lesson 4.3: Coding - Code Lab - Implementing NMS from Scratch
Lesson 4.4: Experiment - The Threshold Sandbox
Lesson 4.5: Example - Real World - The Self-Driving Car Dilemma
Lesson 4.6: Podcast - The Evolution of "Looking"

learningPaths.title: Object Detection II: Single-Shot and Transformer-Based Approaches
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond foundational detectors to explore the revolutionary architectures that enabled real-time performance and true end-to-end learning. We will dissect the innovations of Faster R-CNN, the paradigm-shifting speed of YOLO, and the architectural elegance of the vision Transformer (DETR).

modules.title: Closing the Loop - Faster R-CNN and the RPN
modules.description: Discover the crucial innovation that integrated region proposals directly into the neural network. We'll explore the Region Proposal Network (RPN) and the concept of anchor boxes, which turned two-stage detectors into unified, end-to-end trainable systems.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Closing the Loop - Faster R-CNN and the RPN
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video - The Geometry of Detection
Lesson 1.2: Exercise - The IoU Challenge
Lesson 1.3: Coding - Building the RPN's Judge
Lesson 1.4: Podcast - The Speed of Sight

modules.title: Speed Freaks - The YOLO Revolution
modules.description: Witness a fundamental paradigm shift with the YOLO architecture. We'll learn how reframing detection as a single regression problem unlocked real-time speed and how the grid system and confidence score work together to make it possible.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Speed Freaks - The YOLO Revolution
Lesson 2.1: Manim Math Explainer - Visualizing IoU and Confidence
Lesson 2.2: Experiment - The Grid Responsibility Playground
Lesson 2.3: Exercise - Tensors and Thresholds
Lesson 2.4: Coding - Decoding the Box
Lesson 2.5: Podcast - "The Speed Trap"

modules.title: The Problem of Scale - Feature Pyramid Networks (FPN)
modules.description: Address the fundamental challenge of detecting objects at vastly different scales. We will dissect the Feature Pyramid Network (FPN), a powerful and standard architectural pattern that gives models robust multi-scale vision by combining deep semantics with shallow details.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Problem of Scale - Feature Pyramid Networks (FPN)
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video - Visualizing the Math
Lesson 3.2: Exercises - Crunching the Numbers
Lesson 3.3: Coding - Coding the Pyramid - Building an FPN Block
Lesson 3.4: Podcast - The Semantic Gap

modules.title: The Transformer Era - DETR
modules.description: Explore the latest frontier in object detection with DETR. Learn how borrowing the Transformer architecture from NLP allows us to create an elegant detector that discards hand-crafted components like anchor boxes and NMS by treating detection as a direct set prediction problem.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Transformer Era - DETR
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video - Visualizing the Hungarian Algorithm
Lesson 4.2: Coding - Building the Hungarian Matcher
Lesson 4.3: Experiment - Inside the Transformer's Mind
Lesson 4.4: Exercise - Calculating the Cost
Lesson 4.5: Podcast - "The End of Hand-Crafting?"

learningPaths.title: Semantic Segmentation: A Pixel-Level Understanding
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond simple classification to the most detailed form of scene understanding. We'll learn how machines can be taught to label every single pixel in an image, a critical skill for robotics, medical imaging, and autonomous systems.

modules.title: The "What" and "Why" of Semantic Segmentation
modules.description: Start with the human side of dense prediction. We compare annotation mindsets, visualize dense outputs, and ground the task in real benchmarks before hearing from practitioners living in pixel land.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The "What" and "Why" of Semantic Segmentation
Lesson 1.1: Experiment – The Human Annotator
Lesson 1.2: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing Dense Predictions
Lesson 1.3: Exercise – The Shape of Predictions
Lesson 1.4: Coding – Hello, Mask!
Lesson 1.5: Example – The Cityscapes Benchmark
Lesson 1.6: Podcast – The Pixel Perspective

modules.title: Measuring Success – The Math of IoU
modules.description: Move from intuition to evaluation rigor. We visualize overlaps, run IoU drills, and code the metric from scratch while debating where metrics mislead us.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Measuring Success – The Math of IoU
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing the Overlap
Lesson 2.2: Exercise – The IoU Gym
Lesson 2.3: Coding – Implementing IoU from Scratch
Lesson 2.4: Podcast – The Metric Trap

modules.title: The Blueprint – Encoder-Decoder & FCNs
modules.description: Lay out the structural DNA of segmentation networks. We explore FCNs, skip connections, and hourglass ideas through interactives, code, and mental arithmetic.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Blueprint – Encoder-Decoder & FCNs
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Shape of Data
Lesson 3.2: Experiment – The Skip Connection Playground
Lesson 3.3: Coding – Building the Hourglass in PyTorch
Lesson 3.4: Exercise – Tensor Arithmetic
Lesson 3.5: Podcast – "The Day We Killed the Fully Connected Layer"

modules.title: The Math of Upsampling – Transposed Convolutions
modules.description: Demystify deconvolution. We visualize spread, decode the human intuition of upsampling, and implement ConvTranspose2d from first principles while arguing about the "deconvolution" misnomer.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Math of Upsampling – Transposed Convolutions
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing the "Spread"
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – The Human Decoder
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Building `ConvTranspose2d` from Scratch
Lesson 4.4: Podcast – The "Deconvolution" Debate

modules.title: The Gold Standard – U-Net
modules.description: Celebrate the blueprint that changed medicine. We visualize the math, code a PyTorch U-Net, and run architectural arithmetic drills before recapping its impact on healthcare.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Gold Standard – U-Net
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the Math
Lesson 5.2: Coding - the U-Net in PyTorch
Lesson 5.3: Exercise - Architectural Arithmetic
Lesson 5.4: Podcast - The Architecture That Changed Medicine

modules.title: Context & Boundaries – Advanced Refinements
modules.description: Close with boundary-aware tricks, dilation labs, and modern U-Net builds. We calculate IoU like pros, visualize upsampling, and tinker with receptive fields while discussing the saga of segmentation research.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Context & Boundaries – Advanced Refinements
Lesson 6.1: Exercise Lesson - The Metric Master (Calculating IoU)
Lesson 6.2: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the "Upsample"
Lesson 6.3: Example - The Cityscapes Dataset & Autonomous Driving
Lesson 6.4: Coding - Building a U-Net in PyTorch
Lesson 6.5: Experiment - The Receptive Field & Dilation Lab
Lesson 6.6: Podcast - The Segmentation Saga

learningPaths.title: Advanced Image Segmentation: Instances and Foundation Models
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond basic segmentation to explore the cutting-edge techniques that allow machines to distinguish between individual objects and understand scenes with near-human nuance. We'll journey from refining contextual awareness in CNNs to interacting with massive, promptable foundation models that are redefining what's possible in computer vision.

modules.title: The Context Challenge – DeepLab and ASPP
modules.description: Capture long-range context without sacrificing resolution. We rebuild the DeepLab intuition, visualize atrous rates, and apply ASPP to real Cityscapes edge cases.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Context Challenge – DeepLab and ASPP
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video Explainer – Visualizing Atrous Convolution
Lesson 1.2: Coding Lab – Building ASPP in PyTorch
Lesson 1.3: Experiment – The Receptive Field Tuner
Lesson 1.4: Exercise – Receptive Field Arithmetic
Lesson 1.5: Real-World Example – Cityscapes & The Pole Problem
Lesson 1.6: Podcast – "The Holy Cheese of Deep Learning"

modules.title: The Segmentation Taxonomy – Semantic, Instance, and Panoptic
modules.description: Define "things" vs. "stuff", annotate pixels, and merge masks into panoptic predictions. We explore Tesla’s stack and debate what the true Holy Grail looks like.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Segmentation Taxonomy – Semantic, Instance, and Panoptic
Lesson 2.1: Experiment – The Annotation Station
Lesson 2.2: Coding – The Panoptic Merger
Lesson 2.3: Manim Video Explainer – The Pixel Conflict
Lesson 2.4: Example – The Tesla Vision Stack
Lesson 2.5: Podcast – "Things, Stuff, and The Holy Grail"

modules.title: Mask R-CNN & The Alignment Problem
modules.description: RoIAlign math, mask precision, and the practicalities of running Mask R-CNN. We blend geometry explainers with hands-on PyTorch demos.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Mask R-CNN & The Alignment Problem
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Geometry of RoIAlign
Lesson 3.2: Exercise - The Mathematics of Masks
Lesson 3.3: Coding - Running Mask R-CNN in PyTorch
Lesson 3.4: Podcast - The "Mask" Revolution

modules.title: The Modern Era – Transformers and Foundation Models
modules.description: Meet SAM, transformers, and prompt-driven workflows. We visualize RoIAlign geometry again, practice dilation math, and run prompt-engineer experiments that hint at the future of segmentation.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Modern Era – Transformers and Foundation Models
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer – The Geometry of RoIAlign
Lesson 4.2: Exercise – Calculating with Dilation
Lesson 4.3: Coding – Instance Segmentation with PyTorch
Lesson 4.4: Experiment – The "Prompt Engineer" Playground
Lesson 4.5: Real-World Example – The Self-Driving Car's Eye
Lesson 4.6: Podcast – The Death of the Specialist Model?

learningPaths.title: Human Pose Estimation: From Heatmap Regression to Part Affinity Fields
learningPaths.description: This chapter unpacks the fascinating world of Human Pose Estimation (HPE). We'll journey from the fundamental challenges of the task to the brilliant architectural solutions that power modern systems, exploring how computers learn to see and understand the articulated structure of the human body.

modules.title: The Skeleton in the Machine
modules.description: Kick off HPE by blending history, intuition, and math. We contrast sampling vs. classifying, explore the legacy of motion capture, and build intuition for scale invariance before listening to practitioners decode body language.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Skeleton in the Machine
Lesson 1.1: Experiment - The PCKh Playground
Lesson 1.2: Coding - Loading and Visualizing Keypoints (Python/Colab)
Lesson 1.3: Example - The History of MoCap (Motion Capture)
Lesson 1.4: Manim Video Explainer - The Math of Scale Invariance
Lesson 1.5: Podcast - "The Body Language of Machines"

modules.title: Paradigms of Perception
modules.description: Shift from intuition to probabilistic thinking. This module contrasts coordinate vs. heatmap paradigms, paints with Gaussian belief maps, and debates why modern systems lean on distributions.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Paradigms of Perception
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Gaussian Mountain: Visualizing Belief Maps
Lesson 2.2: Coding Lab - Painting with Probabilities
Lesson 2.3: Experiment - The Crowd Efficiency Challenge
Lesson 2.4: Podcast - TechTalk: Why Coordinates are Out and Heatmaps are In

modules.title: Refining the Pose (Top-Down Architectures)
modules.description: Walk through the delicate choreography of CPM, Hourglass, and top-down refinement. We visualize expanding fields of view, code structural blocks, and run experiments that surface trade-offs.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Delicate Dance of Training
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer - "The Expanding Field of View"
Lesson 3.2: Experiment - "The CPM Refinement Playground"
Lesson 3.3: Coding - "Building an Hourglass Block"
Lesson 3.4: Exercise - "Architectural Arithmetic"
Lesson 3.5: Podcast - "Brute Force vs. Elegance"

modules.title: Connecting the Dots (Bottom-Up & Future)
modules.description: Finish with bottom-up strategies, association scoring, and future-looking ethics. We animate line integrals, hand-match keypoints, code the PAF scorer, and end with a debate on the vector revolution.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Connecting the Dots (Bottom-Up & Future)
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Line Integral Visualization
Lesson 4.2: Exercise - Manual Matching
Lesson 4.3: Coding - Building the PAF Scorer
Lesson 4.4: Podcast - "The Vector Revolution"

learningPaths.title: Generative Adversarial Networks
learningPaths.description: This chapter ventures into the "creative universe" of deep learning. We will dissect the ingenious adversarial framework of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), learning how two competing networks can be trained to generate stunningly realistic images from nothing but random noise. We'll explore the theory, master the training, and discover the common pitfalls and advanced techniques that revolutionized generative AI.

modules.title: Entering the Creative Universe
modules.description: Kick off the chapter by grounding GANs in creativity, probability, and storytelling. This module sets the tone, introduces distributions, and explores why generative models feel more like artists than analysts.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Entering the Creative Universe
Lesson 1.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Math of Distributions
Lesson 1.2: Coding Lab - Sampling vs. Classifying
Lesson 1.3: Real-World Scenarios
Lesson 1.4: Podcast - The Shift to Creativity

modules.title: The Two-Player Game (Framework & Math)
modules.description: Dive deep into the minimax duel between generator and discriminator. We visualize the tug-of-war, build the core PyTorch components, and map the math behind adversarial equilibrium to concrete scenarios.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Two-Player Game (Framework & Math)
Lesson 2.1: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the Minimax Tug-of-War
Lesson 2.2: Coding the Adversaries - Building the Players in PyTorch
Lesson 2.3: Calculating the Standoff - Crunching the Adversarial Numbers
Lesson 2.4: Real-World Example - The Art Auction & The Algorithm
Lesson 2.5: Podcast Review - The Art of War (Between Networks)

modules.title: The Delicate Dance of Training
modules.description: Focus on stabilization strategies, optimization intuition, and the realities of adversarial training. From Minimax geometry to orchestration in code, this module exposes pitfalls and practical fixes.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Delicate Dance of Training
Lesson 3.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Minimax Landscape
Lesson 3.2: Coding - Orchestrating the Loop (PyTorch)
Lesson 3.3: Experiment - The Mode Collapse Lab
Lesson 3.4: Exercise - Calculating the Steps
Lesson 3.5: Podcast - "War Stories from the Training Loop"

modules.title: Judging the Art (Evaluation Metrics)
modules.description: Evaluate generated art with rigor. We unpack Fréchet Inception Distance, build tooling for qualitative and quantitative review, and connect metrics to creative judgment.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Judging the Art (Evaluation Metrics)
Lesson 4.1: Manim Video Explainer - The Geometry of FID
Lesson 4.2: Experiment - The Evaluator's Dashboard
Lesson 4.3: Coding - Calculating FID from Scratch
Lesson 4.4: Podcast - The Art Critic in the Machine

modules.title: Evolving Architectures & The Future
modules.description: Cap the journey with cutting-edge GAN innovations. We visualize saddle points, implement DCGAN, experiment with playgrounds, and explore deepfakes, super-resolution, and future-facing ethics.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Evolving Architectures & The Future
Lesson 5.1: Manim Video Explainer - Visualizing the Saddle Point
Lesson 5.2: Coding - Building a DCGAN for MNIST
Lesson 5.3: Experiment - The GAN Playground
Lesson 5.4: Exercise - Calculation & Evaluation
Lesson 5.5: Example - The Art of Deception (Deepfakes & Super-Resolution)
Lesson 5.6: Podcast - The Forger and the Detective
